intro: Hieracium aphyllum subsp. torrembecense, commonly known as the Torrembec hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced leaf structure and specific geographic distribution. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and taxonomic studies.
